Mediacoder set up/use

Hi all.

I've downloaded the Mediacoder software to convert wav to mp3 using the LAME encoder. At the moment I'm using the LAME encoder via Audacity, but couldn't figure out how to increase the bitrate.

I imported a wav file into Mediacoder, chose LAME, and converted. It says the file is converted from 47megs to 8.6megs (this would be OK for upload to Soundclick). When I played the mp3 though, it was just hiss, no music.

Any ideas?

The Mediacoder is a lot easier front end, and gives the option to select 128, 256, 320 transfer rate etc. Couple of things I'm not sure of though:

1. Does this mean that I have to download the LAME encoder again, or does Mediacoder come with LAME installed already?

2. There was a choice to download 32 or 64 bit Mediacoder - I'm using XP and downloaded the 32 bit. Is that correct?

Thanks

Stoojo Music

Dell 2400, XP 1 Gig RAM, Pentium 4 2.8 Ghz, M-Audio 2496, PSR310, LP Custom, Fender Strat, Yam Acoustic, Peavey amps, Zodiac BXP bass

5 Replies

RE: Mediacoder set up/use (permalink)

There was a choice to download 32 or 64 bit Mediacoder - I'm using XP and downloaded the 32 bit. Is that correct?

Thats something you should ask yourself, Right!! I dont know what XP version you have. I guess you dont either. Go find out if you have XP64 or XP32. Aside from that, i never heard of that encoder. I use Lame and it works great

RE: Mediacoder set up/use (permalink)

Ok cheers anyway. I use LAME at the moment too but can't figure out how to change the conversion from 128 bit to higher, for better conversion.

Do you know how to do it?

Thanks

PS - how do I find out if I'm 32 or 64 bit?
